intro: Vernoniastrum acuminatissimum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed vernonia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its tall, slender stems and small, yellow flowers. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and a distinctive, elongated inflorescence. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to arid environments.
